scripts.annotation_stats module¶

annotation_stats.py is a script that processes annotation results and compiles statistics about the annotations so far.

In total: - # annotated items - # annotated appropriate, average - # annotated inappropriate, average - are original images tagged as appropriate?

For each annotator: - same as in total - agreement with other annotators

If the --t2i option is given, will generate a vtext-image map to the given file.

  • By default, it only outputs text-image pairs for appropriate images on which annotators agreed.
  • If the --relaxed option is given, will output all images that were tagged by at least one annotator (incl. items which were seen by only one annotator).
  • If the --with_solo option is given, will output the images tagged only by one annotator, but from duplicate items, will only output images tagged by both.

Adds a column of the given name to the annotations. Non-destructive (returns a deep copy).

scripts.annotation_stats.apply_on_grid(grid, operation, **operation_kwargs)[source]¶

Applies the given operation on each grid member. The grid is assumed to be the output of a grid_on_ method (currently implemented: only grid_on_intersect): a dict of dicts of lists. The operation is applied to each grid member. The result is again a grid.

scripts.annotation_stats.apply_on_grid_axis(grid, operation, **operation_kwargs)[source]¶

Applies the given operation on the list of values of each top-level grid member (grid row).

scripts.annotation_stats.apply_on_grids(grids, operation, **operation_kwargs)[source]¶

Analogous to apply_on_annotations - applies the given operation to members of grids indexed by the same label pairs. Outputs, again, a grid with the results of the operation.

Computes the reward for individual annotated images.

scripts.annotation_stats.compute_reward(annotations, coef_appropriate=1.0, coef_inappropriate=1.0)[source]¶

Computes how much an annotator should be paid for the given set of annotations.

The formula:

R = time_reward + item_rewards * agreement_coefficient

where:

time_reward = # of minutes in which at least one annotation was sent
item_rewards = sum of individual item rewards
item_reward = dot([1 for _ in annotated_pictures], reward_vector)
reward_vector = [1.0, 0.5, 0.5, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0., 0., 0., 0., 0.]
agreement_coefficient = apppropriate + inappropriate agr. coef. / 2
appropriate agr. coef. = avg. app. precision vs all users / 3rd best avg. prec.
inappropriate agr. coef. = dtto for inapp. precision
Returns:The total reward.
scripts.annotation_stats.compute_time_reward(annotations)[source]¶

Computes the reward for time spent annotating.

scripts.annotation_stats.grid_on_intersection(grouped_annotations, intersect_column, op_column, operation, skip_identical=True, record_counts=True, **op_kwargs)[source]¶

Applies the given operation on each pair of groups in the grouped annotation (on the given column).

Parameters:
  • grouped_annotations – A grouped annotations dict. Grid members will be pairs of groups.
  • intersect_column – The column according to which to compute the intersect of two annotation groups.
  • op_column – The column on which to apply the operation.
  • skip_identical – If set (default), will not include the grid diagonal.
  • operation – The operation which will be applied_on_annotations on the op_column of the intersecting annotations for each grid member.
  • record_counts – If set (default), will assume the column is an array column and will also record counts for items in each intersection. The counts will be recorded in the same structure as the results of the operation, in tuples (count_g1, count_g2).
Returns:

A dictionary of operation results on the given column``s of the intersection of each pair of annotation groups. To find the result for (g1, g2), go through ``results[g1][g2]. The result is a list of results for all members of the intersect between g1 and g2.
scripts.annotation_stats.group_by(annotations, name)[source]¶

Splits the annotations into item arrays with the same name.

Parameters:
  • annotations – The annotations array.
  • name – One of the names in column_names.
Returns:

A dict of annotations arrays. The keys are all values that occur in the name column, the values are the complete annotation items (including the name column!)
scripts.annotation_stats.group_mutual_precision(grouped_annotations, name)[source]¶

Measures the mutual precision in each group in the column with the given name. Intended mainly for measuring items grouped by text.

Returns:A dict with keys corresponding to grouped_annotations groups and values corresponding to mutual precision.
scripts.annotation_stats.human_timeframe(annotations)[source]¶

Gets the timeframe in a human-readable format.

scripts.annotation_stats.inner_join_by(a1, a2, name)[source]¶

Inner-joins the given arrays of dicts by the column with the given name.

scripts.annotation_stats.intersect(a1, a2, name, unique_key='id')[source]¶

Returns two lists of annotations consisting of the items from a1 and a2 that have the same value in the column name. If there is more than one item with the same value in the name column in one of the annotations, a cartesian product of each from a1 – each from a2 is generated.

Parameters:unique_key – If a pair of items in a1, a2 share the unique key, they are considered the same item and not considered in the intersection. This controls self-intersection behavior, when for instance measuring self-agreement.
